member.summary: The location is not over any editor view lines, but it is in the text area.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IActiveEditorViewChangeEventSink

member.summary: Returns the visible offset that is closest to the specified offset.
member.param: The desired offset.

If the desired offset is within a collapsed region, the returned offset will be based on affinity. If true is passed, the collapsed region's end offset will be returned. Otherwise, the collapsed region's start offset will be returned.
member.returns: The visible offset that is closest to the specified offset.
member.remarks: If the desired offset is visible, it is returned directly. Otherwise the desired offset is in a collapsed region, so the offset before/after the region (based on affinity) is returned.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IEditorViewSelection.ToggleRange(ActiproSoftware.Text.TextPositionRange)
member.summary: Toggles a selection range in the collection.
member.param: The containing the range of characters to select.
member.returns: true if a selection range was added/merged; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method can result in multiple selection ranges and related carets. If the specified selection range exactly matches an existing selection range, the existing selection range will be removed. Otherwise, any existing selection ranges that intersect will be removed, and the specified selection range will be added.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies a type of location to algorithm.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm.BestFit
member.summary: If the location is over the left half of a character, the character's position is returned. If the location is over the right half of a character, the next character's position is returned. If the location is past the last character in a line and virtual space past the end of lines is disabled, the position of the last character in the line is returned. If the location is past the end of a document and virtual space past the end of the document is disabled, the position of the last character in the document is returned.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm.Block
member.summary: If the location is over a character, the character's offset is returned. If the location is past the last character in a line and virtual space past the end of lines is disabled, the position of the last character in the line is returned. If the location is past the end of a document and virtual space past the end of the document is disabled, the position of the last character in the document is returned.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm.Absolute
member.summary: If the location is over a character, the character's position is returned. Otherwise, -1 is returned.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CanBackspaceOverSpacesToTabStop
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a Backspace key pressed before the first non-whitespace character of a line will backspace to the previous tab stop.
member.value: true if a Backspace key pressed before the first non-whitespace character of a line will backspace to the previous tab stop; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: This property is only used when is true. When this property is false, only one space character maximum will be consumed when backspacing before the first non-whitespace character of a line.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CanCutCopyBlankLineWhenNoSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cut/copy operations on a blank line with no selection overwrites the clipboard with the blank line.
member.value: true if cut/copy operations on a blank line with no selection overwrites the clipboard with the blank line; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When there is no selection in the editor and a cut or copy operation occurs, the text of the current line will be sent to the clipboard. If the text is subsequently pasted back into the editor while there is no selection, a new link will be created to insert the clipboard data and the caret will not move. Even if this property is false, cutting of blank lines will occur but the clipboard will not be changed.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CanCutCopyDragWithHtml
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the cutting and copying of text to the clipboard or dragging text also copies the text in HTML format, which retains syntax highlighting.
member.value: true if HTML format is included; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Activating this feature will cause a slight delay when cutting, copying, or dragging text since the building of HTML formatted text can take time. However most likely this delay will be negligible.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CanCutCopyDragWithRtf
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the cutting and copying of text to the clipboard or dragging text also copies the text in RTF format, which retains syntax highlighting.
member.value: true if RTF format is included; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Activating this feature will cause a slight delay when cutting, copying, or dragging text since the building of RTF formatted text can take time. However most likely this delay will be negligible.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CanScrollPastDocumentEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets whether it is possible to scroll past the end of the document.
member.value: true if it is possible to scroll past the end of the document; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true, the vertical scrollbar allows scrolling of the last line of the document up to the first view line in the view.

This property should not be set to false when intra-line adornments are used or multiple font faces/sizes are used in highlighting styles, since the vertical scrollbar maximum cannot be properly calculated in those scenarios.
This property has no effect when word wrap mode is active.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.IsTextDataBindingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether data binding on the property is currently enabled.
member.value: true if data binding on the property is currently enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: Data binding is off by default on the property for two reasons. First, supporting the dependency property means that two full copies of the document text are stored in memory instead of one, which can increase memory a lot for large documents. Second, the full text must be set to the dependency property after each text change, meaning performance could suffer depending on the size of the document.
It is recommended to only set to true when data binding is required, and note that the property must be set before creating a binding on the property.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.IsViewLineMeasureEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the editor view lines are measured, allowing the editor to resize as text contents change.
member.value: true if the editor view lines can be measured; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: This property affects performance and should only be set to true in specific scenarios where it is desired for the editor to resize based on contents, such as when used within a StackPanel.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.IsVirtualSpaceAtLineEndEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether virtual space at the end of lines is enabled.
member.value: true if virtual space at the end of lines is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When true, the caret can move past the end of lines. Use of virtual space at the end of lines will disable word wrap.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.ScrollBarAccelerationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the TimeSpan that indicates the amount of time it takes to increase the number of ScrollBar units scrolled per small change during ScrollBar acceleration.
member.value: A TimeSpan indicating the interval. The default value is 3 seconds.
member.remarks:
ScrollBar acceleration kicks in when holding down one of the ScrollBar controls' small change buttons. At each interval specified by , the number of units scrolled with each small change increases by 1 until is reached. This enables you to more quickly scroll large distances through documents.
For example, with the default settings, holding the vertical ScrollBar's down button will start scrolling down 1 line at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 2 lines at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 3 lines at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 4 lines at a time and will no longer increase the lines scrolled per small change. Once the down button is released, everything resets back and acceleration is available for the next scroll operation.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.ScrollBarAccelerationMaximum
member.summary: Gets or sets a value between 1 and 10 that indicates the maximum number of ScrollBar units that are scrolled during peak ScrollBar acceleration.
member.value: A value between 1 and 10 indicating the maximum number of units. Set to 1, the minimum, to disable acceleration. The default value is 4.
member.remarks:
ScrollBar acceleration kicks in when holding down one of the ScrollBar controls' small change buttons. At each interval specified by , the number of units scrolled with each small change increases by 1 until is reached. This enables you to more quickly scroll large distances through documents.
For example, with the default settings, holding the vertical ScrollBar's down button will start scrolling down 1 line at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 2 lines at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 3 lines at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 4 lines at a time and will no longer increase the lines scrolled per small change. Once the down button is released, everything resets back and acceleration is available for the next scroll operation.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.SelectionModesAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the selection modes that are allowed within the editor.
member.value: A value indicating the selection modes that are allowed within the editor. The default value is Block and ContinuousStream.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the complete document text within the editor. This property is created specifically for data binding, and be sure to see the remarks for important configuration and performance information.
member.value: The complete document text within the editor.

remarks.para: Every time the getter of this property is called, the text of the document is reconstructed. Every call to the setter, sets the complete document text. Therefore many calls to this property can be a performance bottleneck.

Data binding is off by default on the property for two reasons. First, supporting the dependency property means that two full copies of the document text are stored in memory instead of one, which can increase memory a lot for large documents. Second, the full text must be set to the dependency property after each text change, meaning performance could suffer depending on the size of the document.

Data binding can be enabled by setting the property to true. It is recommended to only set to true when data binding is required, and note that the property must be set before creating a binding on the property.
When is false, the dependency property is not used and text is get/set directly from the document.
To properly get text substrings from the document, get the current from . and use the method. Likewise, to determine document length, use the . property.
Programmatic document updates should be performed using methods on .

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.TextAreaFontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size to use in the editor's text area only.
member.value: The font size to use in the editor's text area only. The default value is 0.0, meaning use the value of the FontSize property.
member.remarks: The FontSize property will also affect IntelliPrompt popups and overlay panes. Use this text area font size property if you wish to keep those user interface pieces the normal font size and wish to only update the default text area font size.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.VerticalScrollBarVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the that specifies the visibility of the vertical .
member.value: The that specifies the visibility of the vertical . The default value is Visible.
member.remarks: Visible and Auto always show the . Hidden and Disabled always hide the .

member.value: The duration in milliseconds to animate the scale from one zoom level to the next. The default value is 200ms.
member.remarks: Set to 0ms to disable zoom animation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage increment by which the zoom level changes.

member.remarks: Ensure the property is set to an option that supports zooming.

member.summary: Gets or sets the that indicates the input modes by which zooming can occur.
member.value: The that indicates the input modes by which zooming can occur. The default value is All.
member.remarks: Zooming occurs at 0.25 (25%) increments so plan your and settings in increments of 0.25 for best results.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.OutliningState.None
member.summary: The text range does not intersect an outlining node.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.OutliningState.IsTopLevel
member.summary: The start of the text range is not contained within an outlining node.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.OutliningState.HasCollapsedNode
member.summary: The text range contains at least one collapsed node.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.OutliningState.HasExpandedNodeStart
member.summary: The text range contains the start of at least one expanded node.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.OutliningState.HasExpandedNodeEnd
member.summary: The text range contains the end of at least one expanded node.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.OutliningState.IsOpen
member.summary: The text range is completely contained within another outlining node or a node starts in the text range but extends past it.

member.summary: Represents a definition used to create an outlining node.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.Implementation.OutliningNodeDefinition.GetCollapsedContent(ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.IOutliningNode)
member.summary: Returns the content that should be displayed when the outlining node is collapsed.
member.param: The , based on this definition, for which content is requested.
member.returns: The content that should be displayed when the outlining node is collapsed.
member.remarks: Only string-based content is currently supported. The default implementation of this method returns the value of the property. This method can be overridden to generate unique collapsed content for a particular node.

member.summary: Returns a String that represents the current Object.
member.returns: A String that represents the current Object.

member.summary: Initializes the OutliningNodeDefinition class.
member.param: The string-based key that identifies the object.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.Implementation.OutliningNodeDefinition.DefaultCollapsedContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the default content that should be displayed when the outlining node is collapsed.
member.value: The default content that should be displayed when the outlining node is collapsed.
member.remarks: Only string-based content is currently supported. This property may be left to use the global default collapsed content.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.Implementation.OutliningNodeDefinition.HasEndDelimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the outlining node ends using a delimiter.
member.value: true if the outlining node ends using a delimiter; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property can be set to false to hint to the outlining manager that the node might be properly closed even though it doesn't have an end delimiter.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.Implementation.OutliningNodeDefinition.IsCollapsible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the outlining node is capable of being collapsed.
member.value: true if the outlining node is capable of being collapsed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.Implementation.OutliningNodeDefinition.IsDefaultCollapsed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the outlining node is collapsed by default.
member.value: true if the outlining node is collapsed by default; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Pre-processor region nodes are examples of nodes that are generally collapsed by default.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Outlining.Implementation.OutliningNodeDefinition.IsImplementation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the outlining node represents some sort of member implementation that should be auto-collapsed when collapsing to definitions.
member.value: true if the outlining node represents some sort of member implementation; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IntelliPrompt.ICodeSnippetProvider

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IntelliPrompt.ICompletionSession.AllowedCharacters
member.summary: Gets the containing the non-letter/digit characters allowed to be typed while the completion popup is displayed.
member.value: The containing the non-letter/digit characters allowed to be typed while the completion popup is displayed.
member.remarks:
All letter and digit characters are automatically allowed by the completion popup and therefore do not need to added to this property. This property should only contain additional non-letter/digit characters that need to be allowed.
When a character is typed, it's first checked to see if it's a letter, number, or is in the collection. If any of those cases is true, the character is entered into the editor and the session remains open. If instead the character is in the collection and there is a full selection in the completion list, a occurs. Otherwise, the session is cancelled.

member.value: true if the session can immediately commit if a single match is made when the session is opened; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: A value of false will force the popup list to always display, even if a single match is made upon open.

When a character is typed, it's first checked to see if it's a letter, number, or is in the collection. member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IntelliPrompt.Implementation.CompletionSession.AllowedCharacters
member.summary: Gets or sets the containing the non-letter/digit characters allowed to be typed while the completion popup is displayed.
member.value: The containing the non-letter/digit characters allowed to be typed while the completion popup is displayed.
member.remarks:
All letter and digit characters are automatically allowed by the completion popup and therefore do not need to added to this property. This property should only contain additional non-letter/digit characters that need to be allowed.
When a character is typed, it's first checked to see if it's a letter, number, or is in the collection. If any of those cases is true, the character is entered into the editor and the session remains open. If instead the character is in the collection and there is a full selection in the completion list, a occurs. Otherwise, the session is cancelled.

member.remarks: A value of false will force the popup list to always display, even if a single match is made upon open.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Highlighting.Implementation.HighlightingStyleRegistry.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.EditorViewAutomationPeer.Scroll(System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount,System.Windows.Automation.ScrollAmount)
member.summary: Scrolls the visible region of the content area horizontally and vertically.
member.param: The horizontal increment specific to the control. ScrollPatternIdentifiers.NoScroll should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
The vertical increment specific to the control. ScrollPatternIdentifiers.NoScroll should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
member.exception: If a control supports ScrollAmount.SmallIncrement values exclusively for horizontal or vertical scrolling but a ScrollAmount.LargeIncrement value is passed in.
An attempt is made to scroll in an unsupported direction.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.EditorViewAutomationPeer.SetScrollPercent(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the horizontal and vertical scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.
member.param: The horizontal position as a percentage of the content area's total range. should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
The vertical position as a percentage of the content area's total range. should be passed in if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
member.exception: A value that cannot be converted to a double is passed in.

A value greater than 100 or less than 0 is passed in (except -1, which is equivalent to ScrollPatternIdentifiers.NoScroll). The IScrollProvider.HorizontalScrollPercent and IScrollProvider.VerticalScrollPercent values are normalized to either 100 percent or 0 percent.
An attempt is made to scroll in an unsupported direction.

member.summary: Exposes text snapshot ranges to UI Automation for a specified .

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.AddToSelection
member.summary: Adds to the collection of highlighted text in a text container that supports multiple, disjoint selections.
member.exception: If text provider does not support multiple, disjoint selections (that is, ITextProvider.SupportedTextSelection must have a value of Multiple).

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.Clone
member.summary: Returns a new identical to the original and inheriting all properties of the original.
member.returns: The new text range. A reference is never returned.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.Compare(System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the span of a text range is the same as another text range.
member.param: A text range to compare
member.returns: true if the span of both text ranges is identical; otherwise false.
member.exception: If the range being compared does not come from the same text provider.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.CompareEndpoints(System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRangeEndpoint,System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider,System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRangeEndpoint)
member.summary: Returns a value that specifies whether two text ranges have identical endpoints.
member.param: The TextPatternRangeEndpoint.Start or TextPatternRangeEndpoint.End endpoint of the caller.
The target range for comparison.
The TextPatternRangeEndpoint.Start or TextPatternRangeEndpoint.End endpoint of the target.
member.returns: Returns a negative value if the caller's endpoint occurs earlier in the text than the target endpoint. Returns zero if the caller's endpoint is at the same location as the target endpoint. Returns a positive value if the caller's endpoint occurs later in the text than the target endpoint.
member.exception: If is from a different text provider.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.ExpandToEnclosingUnit(System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextUnit)
member.summary: Expands the text range to the specified text unit.
member.param: The textual unit.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.FindAttribute(System.Int32,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a text range subset that has the specified attribute value.
member.param: The attribute to search for.
The attribute value to search for. This value must match the type specified for the attribute.
true if the last occurring text range should be returned instead of the first; otherwise false.
member.returns: A text range having a matching attribute and attribute value; otherwise .

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.FindText(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a text range subset that contains the specified text.
member.param: The text string to search for.
true if the last occurring text range should be returned instead of the first; otherwise false.
true if case should be ignored; otherwise false.
member.returns: A text range matching the specified text; otherwise null (Nothing in Microsoft Visual Basic .NET).

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.GetAttributeValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the value of the specified attribute across the text range.
member.param: The text attribute.
member.returns: Retrieves an object representing the value of the specified attribute. For example, GetAttributeValue(TextPattern.FontNameAttribute) would return a string that represents the font name of the text range while GetAttributeValue(TextPattern.IsItalicAttribute) would return a value of type . Returns TextPattern.MixedAttributeValue if the value of the specified attribute varies over the text range. Returns AutomationElement.NotSupported if the specified attribute is not supported by the provider or the control.
member.exception: If the specified attribute is not valid.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.GetBoundingRectangles
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of bounding rectangles for each fully or partially visible line of text in a text range.
member.returns: An array of bounding rectangles for each full or partial line of text in a text range. An empty array for a degenerate range. An empty array for a text range that has screen coordinates placing it completely off-screen, scrolled out of view, or obscured by an overlapping window.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.GetChildren
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of all embedded objects that fall within the text range.
member.returns: A collection of child objects that fall within the range. Children that overlap with the text range but are not entirely enclosed by it will also be included in the collection. Returns an empty collection if there are no child objects.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.GetEnclosingElement
member.summary: Returns the innermost control that encloses the text range.
member.returns: The enclosing control, typically the text provider that supplies the text range. However, if the text provider supports child elements such as tables or hyperlinks, then the enclosing element could be a descendant of the text provider.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.GetText(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the plain text of the range.
member.param: The maximum length of the string to return. Use -1 if no limit is required.
member.returns: The plain text of the text range, possibly truncated at the specified max length.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.Move(System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the text range the specified number of text units.
member.param: The text unit boundary.
The number of text units to move. A positive value moves the text range forward, a negative value moves the text range backward, and 0 has no effect.
member.returns: The number of units actually moved. This can be less than the number requested if either of the new text range endpoints is greater than or less than the ITextProvider.DocumentRange endpoints.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.MoveEndpointByRange(System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRangeEndpoint,System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider,System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRangeEndpoint)
member.summary: Moves one endpoint of a text range to the specified endpoint of a second text range.
member.param: The endpoint to move.
Another range from the same text provider.
An endpoint on the other range.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.MoveEndpointByUnit(System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRangeEndpoint,System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves one endpoint of the text range the specified number of text units within the document range.
member.param: The endpoint to move.
The textual unit for moving.
The number of units to move. A positive value moves the endpoint forward. A negative value moves backward. A value of 0 has no effect.
member.returns: The number of units actually moved, which can be less than the number requested if moving the endpoint runs into the beginning or end of the document.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.RemoveFromSelection
member.summary: Removes a highlighted section of text, corresponding to the caller's TextPatternRangeEndpoint.Start and TextPatternRangeEndpoint.End endpoints, from the collection of highlighted text in a text container that supports multiple, disjoint selections.
member.exception: If text provider does not support multiple, disjoint selections (for example, TextPattern.SupportedTextSelection must have a value of Multiple).

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.Automation.Peers.TextRangeProvider.ScrollIntoView(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Causes the text control to scroll vertically until the text range is visible in the viewport.
member.param: true if the text control should be scrolled so the text range is flush with the top of the viewport; false if it should be flush with the bottom of the viewport.

member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory
member.summary: Provides access to the built-in instances, that export text to other formats such as HTML or RTF markup.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory.CreateHtmlClassBased
member.summary: Returns an that can export text to HTML, using CSS classes for syntax highlighting.
member.returns: An that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: CSS class references will be used for highlighting. This type adds a STYLE tag block to the exported HTML where CSS classes are defined. The text in the code block references these CSS classes, therefore allowing color settings to easily be altered for each highlighting style (i.e. keywords, comments, etc.). Root HTML, BODY and other tags will be added to the output.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory.CreateHtmlClipboard
member.summary: Returns an that can export text to HTML, in a format that is compatible with the Windows clipboard HTML data format.
member.returns: An that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: The output of this exporter is the same as , except that some additional information is added to make the exported text compatible with the Windows clipboard HTML data format.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory.CreateHtmlInline
member.summary: Returns an that can export text to HTML, using inline CSS for syntax highlighting.
member.returns: An that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: Inline CSS styles will be used for highlighting. This type allows for the code block to be directly copied out of the exported document and pasted into another. Root HTML, BODY and other tags will be added to the output.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory.CreateHtmlInlineFragment
member.summary: Returns an that can export text to HTML, using inline CSS for syntax highlighting and no root HTML or BODY tags.
member.returns: An that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: Inline CSS styles will be used for highlighting. This type allows for the code block to be directly copied out of the exported document and pasted into another. Root HTML, BODY and other tags will not be added to the output.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory.CreateRtf
member.summary: Returns an that can export text to RTF.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR
member.summary: Provides access to the string resources of this assembly, also allowing for their customization.
member.remarks:
Call the method to return a resolved resource string. If a custom string has been set for a specified string resource name, it will be returned. Otherwise, the default string resource value is returned.
If any of the resource strings are customized via a call to , it is best to do so before any other classes in this assembly are referenced, such as in the application startup.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.ClearCustomStrings
member.summary: Removes all custom strings.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.ContainsCustomString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether a custom string is defined for the specified string resource.
member.param: The name of the resource for which to search.
member.returns: true if a custom string is defined for the specified string resource; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.GetCustomString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns custom string that is stored for the specified string resource, if any.
member.param: The name of the resource to get.
member.returns: The custom string that is stored for the specified string resource, if any.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR.GetString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the specified string resource.
member.param: The name of the resource to get.
member.returns: The value of the resource localized for the caller's current culture settings. If a best match is not possible, is returned.

member.summary: Returns the resolved value of the specified string resource.
member.param: The name of the resource to get.
member.returns: The value of the resource localized for the caller's current culture settings. If a best match is not possible, is returned.
